pair.Response:
Prompt: In the case of Anderson v. United States, what was the purpose of the Traders' Live Stock Exchange?
Response: The purpose of the Traders' Live Stock Exchange was to promote and protect all interests connected with the buying and selling of live stock at the Kansas City Stock Yards, and to cultivate courteous and manly conduct towards each other, and give dignity and responsibility to yard traders. The case was decided on October 24, 1898.
